title: The COVID-19 death rate is dishonest.

body:
Yep. The death count for COVID that they keep track of is of people who died *with* COVID. They didn't necessarily had to have been tested for COVID. All the doctor needs to do is to write COVID as a contributing factor and the hospital gets a bunch of money from the federal government. 

And then the media takes these numbers, compares them to the flu where deaths are counted very differently, and argue that COVID is much worse than the flu. Completely dishonest.
body_html:
Yep. The death count for COVID that they keep track of is of people who died with COVID. They didn't necessarily had to have been tested for COVID. All the doctor needs to do is to write COVID as a contributing factor and the hospital gets a bunch of money from the federal government.

And then the media takes these numbers, compares them to the flu where deaths are counted very differently, and argue that COVID is much worse than the flu. Completely dishonest.

body: That goes for virtually any disease. Official statistics never account for assymptomatic or mild cases that don’t require hospitalization. Even using estimates that account for that, Covid 19 is 50-200 deadlier than influenza. It’s no smallpox, but it’s no flu also. Caution is paramount.

body: Why include politics on about everything (this goes for both sides of the aisle)? Covid is not the ultimate plague, but it is deadlier than the flu and the fear is perfectly reasonable. There’s no conspiracy. As I always say, caution is paramount.

post.title: The COVID-19 death rate is dishonest.

body: CDC says that last year we had 24,000 to 62,000 flu deaths in US, and the number of COVID deaths is 149,000. Ignoring that the COVID deaths are highly inflated, that puts the deadliness of the virus at 3-6 times that of the flu, not 50-200 times.

body:
You’re forgetting that the flu is pretty underreported because of its relative mildness and also [your statistics are wrong.](https://www.nationalgeographic.com/science/2020/07/coronavirus-deadlier-than-many-believed-infection-fatality-rate-cvd/).

Stressing: it’s not an extinction event plague (that would be Ebola if it ever became airborne), but it’s not the flu as well.

body:
People posting screenshots of supposed text on websites and calling it evidence is pretty ridiculous.

Firstly, a user commenting can comment whatever the fuck they want, including lies.

Secondly, screenshots can be very easily faked. Here I'll do a couple real quick:

Here is CNN absolutely falling in love with Trump: https://i.imgur.com/cUGfuzF.png

And here is Donald Trump changing his Twitter profile to say he loves CNN back: https://i.imgur.com/CMXu3XE.png

People gobble this shit up but it means nothing.
body_html:

Secondly, screenshots can be very easily faked. Here I'll do a couple real quick:

And here is Donald Trump changing his Twitter profile to say he loves CNN back: https://i.imgur.com/CMXu3XE.png

People gobble this shit up but it means nothing.

body: Because it's not. The numbers are greatly exaggerated because causing panic is what the media does best. Fear generates the most clicks and viewers. As was already said, everyone who dies and tests positive is counted as a covid death, even if that obviously wasn't the cause of it. They're also testing to see how far they can expand governmental rule.

post.title: The COVID-19 death rate is dishonest.

body:
People making this about politics is just sad. There’s where some conspiracy theories can be objectively hurtful. Covid 19 is a viral pneumonia, far deadlier than the flu and as contagious as the common cold. 

I’m sure there are people trying to take advantage of the situation (as it happens with any catastrophic event, from hurricanes to pandemics), but trying to downplay a deadly, highly contagious disease because it doesn’t fit one’s favorite narrative is borderline psychopathic.
body_html:
People making this about politics is just sad. There’s where some conspiracy theories can be objectively hurtful. Covid 19 is a viral pneumonia, far deadlier than the flu and as contagious as the common cold.

I’m sure there are people trying to take advantage of the situation (as it happens with any catastrophic event, from hurricanes to pandemics), but trying to downplay a deadly, highly contagious disease because it doesn’t fit one’s favorite narrative is borderline psychopathic.

body:
You’re comparing just absolutely numbers to begin with. I’ll fix it for you:

The CDC estimates between 35-50mi flu cases in then US with 24-62k fatalities. For Covid 19, 4mi estimated cases resulted in 150k fatalities. That shows Covid 19 is 50 to 200 times deadlier than the flu.
body_html:
You’re comparing just absolutely numbers to begin with. I’ll fix it for you:

The CDC estimates between 35-50mi flu cases in then US with 24-62k fatalities. For Covid 19, 4mi estimated cases resulted in 150k fatalities. That shows Covid 19 is 50 to 200 times deadlier than the flu.

body: Even if the true number of Covid 19 was half the amount reported, which is very unlikely, it would still be 25 to 100 times deadlier than the flu (see my comment below). You simply cannot compare it to the flu. (not to forget it has no vaccine or treatment and it’s three times as contagious).

body: The 4 million number for COVID cases isn't estimated, it's the number that tested positive. There is a large difference between the number tested and the number of infections. Vast majority of people who got infected were not tested.

body: No, it doesn’t. Please refer to the link I posted earlier. Even if you assume only 10% of the Covid cases are accounted for (which is extreme but let’s assume it for the sake of argument) it would still be 10-20 times deadlier than the Flu. But NY data allows us to say probably 50% of the cases are accounted for. Again, refer to the link. And then the figure of 50-200 times deadlier holds.
body_html: No, it doesn’t. Please refer to the link I posted earlier. Even if you assume only 10% of the Covid cases are accounted for (which is extreme but let’s assume it for the sake of argument) it would still be 10-20 times deadlier than the Flu. But NY data allows us to say probably 50% of the cases are accounted for. Again, refer to the link. And then the figure of 50-200 times deadlier holds.
